claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination improves tumor sensitivity to anti-PD-L1 therapy.

evidence.quote: Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice
Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: The mechanism involves induction of Type I interferon signaling and improved antigen presentation.

evidence.quote: Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Retrospective human data suggests prior mRNA vaccination correlates with better ICI outcomes.

evidence.quote: Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
Combined intervention ... aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.claim: Lipid nanoparticles alone are insufficient to cause the sensitization; mRNA is required.

evidence.quote: Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect.
Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.
